intents.responses: Hello! I'm MediAI üë®‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è. Please describe your symptoms and I'll try to help.
Take care and stay healthy! Goodbye üòä
Happy to help! Remember to consult a doctor for professional medical advice üè•

patterns: I have a runny nose and sore throat
I feel like I have a cold
intents.responses:
**Common Cold ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink warm liquids (ginger tea, chicken soup, honey-lemon water).
- Gargle with warm salt water for a sore throat.
- Use a humidifier to ease congestion.
- Rest well and stay hydrated.
- Steam inhalation to clear nasal passages.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor if symptoms worsen after 10 days.

patterns: I feel very weak with fever
intents.responses:
**Flu (Influenza) ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Stay hydrated with water, herbal teas, and broths.
- Rest as much as possible ‚Äî your body needs it.
- Ginger or honey tea to soothe the throat and reduce inflammation.
- Tulsi (holy basil) tea to help reduce fever.
- Avoid contact with others to prevent spreading.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Seek medical help if fever exceeds 103¬∞F or breathing becomes difficult.

**Migraine ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink ginger tea to help with nausea.
- Apply a cold or warm compress to the forehead or neck.
- Rest in a dark, quiet room.
- Stay hydrated and avoid triggers (bright light, strong smells, stress).
- Magnesium-rich foods (nuts, seeds) may help reduce frequency.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Consult a neurologist if migraines are frequent or very severe.

**Diarrhea ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution) to replace lost fluids.
- Follow the BRAT diet: Bananas, Rice, Applesauce, Toast.
- Ginger or peppermint tea to soothe the stomach.
- Avoid dairy, fatty foods, and caffeine until recovered.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Seek urgent care if diarrhea lasts more than 2 days or you see blood.

patterns: I cannot go to the bathroom
intents.responses:
**Constipation ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink plenty of water (8+ glasses/day).
- Eat fiber-rich foods: fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lentils.
- Drink warm lemon water in the morning.
- Exercise regularly to stimulate digestion.
- Prunes or prune juice are natural laxatives.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor if constipation persists for more than a week.

patterns: Pain or scratchiness in the throat
intents.responses:
**Sore Throat ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Gargle with warm salt water 3‚Äì4 times a day.
- Drink honey and lemon tea to soothe inflammation.
- Use a humidifier to keep the throat moist.
- Suck on ice chips or gargle with cold water for pain relief.
- Avoid irritants like smoke and dry air.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor if you have white patches, high fever, or symptoms lasting over a week.

**Acid Reflux (GERD) ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Mix 1 tsp baking soda in water for quick relief.
- Chew sugar-free gum after meals to neutralize acid.
- Avoid spicy, fatty, and acidic foods.
- Eat smaller, more frequent meals.
- Don't lie down immediately after eating.
- Elevate the head of your bed by 6‚Äì8 inches.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Persistent acid reflux can damage the esophagus ‚Äî see a gastroenterologist.

**Sinusitis ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Steam inhalation with a few drops of eucalyptus oil.
- Stay hydrated to thin the mucus.
- Use a saline nasal spray or neti pot.
- Warm compresses on the face to relieve pressure.
- Avoid allergens and cigarette smoke.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor if symptoms persist beyond 10 days or you have severe facial pain.

**Indigestion ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink ginger tea or chew fresh ginger slices.
- Avoid eating large heavy meals ‚Äî eat smaller portions.
- Drink warm water with lemon and honey before meals.
- Fennel seeds after meals help reduce gas and bloating.
- Peppermint tea aids digestion.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è If indigestion is persistent or severe, rule out ulcers with a doctor.

**Cough ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Mix honey with turmeric in warm water or milk.
- Inhale steam with a few drops of eucalyptus oil.
- Drink ginger tea to reduce throat irritation.
- Honey and black pepper are effective natural cough suppressants.
- Stay well-hydrated.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor if cough lasts more than 3 weeks or you cough up blood.

**Asthma ‚Äî Home Remedies (for mild symptoms):**
- Drink warm water with honey and ginger to ease breathing.
- Inhale steam with peppermint oil.
- Avoid allergens: dust, smoke, pet dander, pollen.
- Practice breathing exercises (pursed-lip breathing).
- Keep windows closed during high pollen days.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Asthma attacks are medical emergencies. Always carry your inhaler and seek immediate help for severe episodes.

**Urinary Tract Infection (UTI) ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink unsweetened cranberry juice.
- Stay well-hydrated with plenty of water.
- Take a warm bath to ease discomfort.
- Avoid caffeine, alcohol, and spicy foods.
- Vitamin C supplements may help acidify urine.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è UTIs require antibiotics ‚Äî please see a doctor promptly to avoid complications.

**Allergic Rhinitis (Hay Fever) ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink peppermint or chamomile tea to reduce inflammation.
- Use a saline nasal spray to clear allergens.
- Keep windows closed during high pollen times.
- Shower after being outdoors to remove pollen.
- Local honey may help build tolerance to local pollen.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Antihistamines prescribed by a doctor offer more effective relief for moderate-to-severe cases.

patterns: pounding in the chest or neck
intents.responses:
**Hypertension (High Blood Pressure) ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink hibiscus or green tea regularly.
- Eat a diet rich in potassium (bananas, spinach, sweet potatoes).
- Reduce sodium intake significantly.
- Practice deep breathing and meditation daily.
- Exercise at least 30 minutes most days.
- Limit alcohol and avoid smoking.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è High blood pressure is a silent killer ‚Äî monitor it regularly and follow your doctor's prescription.

patterns: I feel tired but can't sleep
intents.responses:
**Insomnia ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink chamomile or valerian root tea before bed.
- Practice relaxation techniques: meditation, deep breathing, or yoga.
- Limit screen time at least 1 hour before bedtime.
- Keep a consistent sleep schedule (same time every day).
- Keep the bedroom cool, dark, and quiet.
- Avoid caffeine after 2 PM.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Chronic insomnia (3+ months) should be evaluated by a doctor.

**Fever ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink tulsi (holy basil) tea to help reduce fever.
- Take a lukewarm sponge bath ‚Äî avoid cold water.
- Stay hydrated with water and herbal teas (electrolyte drinks help).
- Rest and keep the room well-ventilated.
- A wet cloth on the forehead can provide relief.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Seek immediate medical care if fever exceeds 103¬∞F, lasts more than 3 days, or is accompanied by seizures.

patterns: Dull or sharp pain in the lower or upper back
intents.responses:
**Back Pain ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Apply a hot compress for muscle spasms or a cold pack for acute injury.
- Perform gentle stretching exercises (cat-cow, child's pose).
- Drink turmeric milk for its anti-inflammatory properties.
- Maintain good posture while sitting and standing.
- Sleep on a firm mattress on your side with a pillow between your knees.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è See a doctor if pain is severe, radiates down your leg, or is accompanied by weakness or numbness.

patterns: I feel very thirsty all the time
intents.responses:
**Diabetes ‚Äî Management Tips:**
- Drink bitter gourd (karela) juice ‚Äî it helps lower blood sugar naturally.
- Fenugreek seeds soaked overnight, drunk in the morning, can help.
- Eat a low-glycemic diet: whole grains, vegetables, legumes.
- Exercise regularly ‚Äî 30 minutes of brisk walking daily.
- Monitor blood glucose levels regularly.
- Cinnamon tea may help improve insulin sensitivity.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Diabetes requires medical management. Follow your doctor's treatment plan strictly.

patterns: I feel nervous all the time
I feel a sense of dread
intents.responses:
**Anxiety ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Practice deep belly breathing (4-7-8 technique) during anxious moments.
- Drink chamomile or ashwagandha tea to calm the nervous system.
- Regular aerobic exercise significantly reduces anxiety.
- Limit caffeine and alcohol.
- Journaling and mindfulness meditation are powerful tools.
- Maintain a consistent daily routine.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Severe or persistent anxiety should be evaluated by a mental health professional.

patterns: sleep too much or too little
weight gain or loss with sadness
intents.responses:
**Depression ‚Äî Supportive Strategies:**
- Regular exercise (even 20 min of walking) boosts endorphins significantly.
- Maintain a consistent sleep schedule.
- Stay connected with trusted friends or family.
- Sunlight exposure in the morning helps regulate mood.
- Omega-3 rich foods (salmon, walnuts, flaxseeds) support brain health.
- Practice gratitude journaling.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Depression is a serious condition. Please speak to a mental health professional ‚Äî therapy and/or medication can be life-changing.

**Skin Allergy ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Apply aloe vera gel to the affected area for cooling relief.
- Use a cold compress to reduce itching and swelling.
- Oatmeal bath soothes inflamed, itchy skin.
- Apply diluted tea tree oil or coconut oil.
- Avoid known allergens (certain soaps, metals, foods).
- Antihistamine foods: quercetin-rich foods like apples and onions.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Seek immediate care for severe reactions with swelling, breathing difficulty (anaphylaxis).

patterns: I have pimples on my face
intents.responses:
**Acne ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Apply diluted tea tree oil (natural antibacterial) to spots.
- Use aloe vera gel as a gentle, soothing spot treatment.
- Apply a honey mask ‚Äî honey has antimicrobial properties.
- Wash face twice daily with a gentle cleanser.
- Avoid touching your face and change pillowcases frequently.
- Reduce sugar and dairy intake as they can trigger breakouts.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Severe or cystic acne should be treated by a dermatologist.

**Dandruff ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Massage the scalp with coconut oil mixed with lemon juice.
- Diluted tea tree oil added to shampoo helps fight fungus.
- Rinse hair with apple cider vinegar solution (1:1 with water).
- Neem oil is a powerful antifungal scalp treatment.
- Avoid hot showers which strip natural oils.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è If dandruff is severe or accompanied by hair loss, see a dermatologist.

**Arthritis ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Turmeric milk (golden milk) is a powerful natural anti-inflammatory.
- Epsom salt baths help reduce joint swelling.
- Warm or cold compresses on painful joints.
- Omega-3 fatty acids (fish oil, flaxseeds) reduce inflammation.
- Gentle exercises like swimming or yoga maintain joint mobility.
- Ginger tea daily helps with pain and stiffness.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Arthritis requires medical diagnosis and management ‚Äî see a rheumatologist.

**Dehydration ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Drink water slowly and steadily ‚Äî sip, don't gulp.
- ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution) replenishes lost salts and fluids.
- Coconut water is an excellent natural electrolyte drink.
- Eat water-rich foods: cucumber, watermelon, oranges.
- Avoid caffeine and alcohol which worsen dehydration.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Severe dehydration (confusion, fainting, no urine for 8+ hours) requires emergency care.

patterns: my eyes hurt after computer work
I have been staring at screens all day
intents.responses:
**Eye Strain ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Follow the 20-20-20 rule: every 20 min, look 20 feet away for 20 seconds.
- Place cool cucumber slices or chilled tea bags on closed eyes.
- Use artificial tear eye drops for dryness.
- Adjust screen brightness and use blue-light filtering glasses.
- Ensure your workspace has adequate lighting.
- Gently massage your temples and around the eye sockets.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Sudden vision loss or severe eye pain needs immediate medical attention.

patterns: pain when eating cold or hot food
intents.responses:
**Toothache ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Clove oil contains eugenol, a natural anesthetic ‚Äî apply to the tooth.
- Rinse with warm salt water to reduce inflammation.
- Apply a cold ice pack on the cheek to numb pain.
- Garlic paste has antibacterial properties ‚Äî apply near the tooth.
- Over-the-counter dental gel (benzocaine) provides temporary relief.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Toothaches require dental treatment. See a dentist as soon as possible to prevent infection.

**Nausea ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Sip cold ginger tea or chew on a piece of raw ginger.
- Peppermint tea or inhaling peppermint oil can ease nausea.
- Sip clear fluids slowly (water, flat ginger ale, broth).
- Eat small, bland meals (crackers, toast, bananas).
- Acupressure on the P6 point (inner wrist) may relieve nausea.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Seek care if nausea is persistent, severe, or accompanied by chest pain or bloody vomit.

**Muscle Cramps ‚Äî Home Remedies:**
- Gently stretch and massage the cramped muscle immediately.
- Apply a heating pad or warm towel to relax the muscle.
- Drink water or an electrolyte drink ‚Äî cramps are often due to dehydration.
- Eat potassium-rich foods: bananas, oranges, potatoes.
- Magnesium supplementation helps prevent nocturnal (night) cramps.

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Frequent severe cramps may indicate poor circulation or nerve issues ‚Äî see a doctor.
